p: Out‐of‐pocket expenditure should not occur for provision of these services since they are included in the POS, and hence are covered by the public healthcare insurer. Provision of a sufficient supply of services according to the population's needs, reducing administrative barriers for access to services, and determining why out‐of‐pocket payments are being made need to be investigated. Evidence shows that higher out‐of‐pocket payments result in poorer population health outcomes. 37
